title: Veolia supports the UK's first low carbon, heating and cooling network - Food and Drink Technology
summary: A new low carbon energy network at the SmartParc site near Derby aims to cut carbon emissions for food manufacturing by 30,000 tonnes per year. The system uses sustainable energy sources and innovative technologies to provide heating and cooling needs for the food manufacturers on the site while reducing environmental impacts.

title: Energising the North East | Manufacturing 100 Interview with Steve Scrimshaw - Insider Media
summary: Siemens Energy in the North East is focused on energy transition and decarbonization. The company provides technology for energy generation, transmission, and storage including wind farm equipment and turbine technology. They are also involved in carbon capture projects like Net Zero Teesside and are developing hydrogen power units to provide off-grid electricity using green hydrogen.

business_innovation: TRUE. Siemens Energy's focus on energy transition, developing new technologies, and serving customers with innovative solutions qualifies as business innovation in the energy sector.
green_product: TRUE. Siemens Energy's technology for energy generation, transmission, and storage that emphasizes renewable energy sources and efficiency aligns with the definition of green products.
green_process: TRUE. Siemens Energy's commitment to minimizing environmental impact through technologies like carbon capture and hydrogen power units demonstrates a focus on green processes and sustainability in manufacturing and energy production.
